intro: Canthium didymum, commonly known as the two-seed burr or African burr, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny, capsule-like fruits that contain two seeds each. These fruits are adapted for dispersal by attaching to the fur or skin of animals. Canthium didymum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in dry, sandy soils.
